senses.de: To produce or create (something, such as an idea, a plan, or a solution) after a period of thought or effort.
senses.ex: She came up with a brilliant idea for the new marketing campaign.

Tips.title: Suggesting a solution
Tips.description: Use 'come up with' when you're suggesting a solution to a problem or offering an idea.
Tips.example: We need to come up with a way to increase sales.

Tips.title: Creating something new
Tips.description: Use 'come up with' to describe the process of creating or inventing something new.
Tips.example: The engineers came up with a new design for the engine.

devise.wordDefinition: 'Devise' implies careful planning and ingenuity, often for something complex. 'Come up with' is more general and can be used for simpler ideas as well.

think of.wordDefinition: 'Think of' is more general and can refer to any thought that comes to mind. 'Come up with' suggests a more deliberate effort to generate an idea or solution.

create.wordDefinition: 'Create' is broader and encompasses the act of bringing something into existence. 'Come up with' specifically refers to the generation of ideas or solutions.
